First_Day_Hikes.Details: Celebrate a New Year with Pine Mountain Trail Association guides as they lead hikers through a diverse mixed hardwood forest.  Discover wildlife and historic CCC sites that make this Piedmont region park  notable.   Bring water and wear sturdy shoes.

Join a ranger as we explore a beautiful backcountry area of the park before the trail is built. Our 2 mile cross country adventure will follow old road beds, ridges, hills and valleys. Moderate to strenuous. Call the Visitor Center to reserve a spot. Limited to 15 hikers  .Bring water and wear sturdy shoes.

First_Day_Hikes.Restrictions: rough and rocky terrain, 3 miles one-way
First_Day_Hikes.Details: water, hiking boots, snack, dress for weather and weather changes
First_Day_Hikes.Meeting_Location: Boulders Access Area, Crowders Mountain State Park, NC

First_Day_Hikes.Details: Water and comfortable walking shoes
water and comfortable walking shoes
water and comfortable walking shoes
water and comfortable walking shoes
Water, comfortable walking shoes
water, comfortable walking shoes, camera

First_Day_Hikes.Restrictions: uneven, rocky, unpaved trail with steps
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Water, snack, comfortable hiking boots/shoes, camera, dress for weather
water and comfortable hiking shoes
water and comfortable hiking shoes
running shoes
water, comfortable hiking/walking shoes, binoculars, camera
First_Day_Hikes.Trail: Oconee Bell Trail or Bear Cove Nature Trail

First_Day_Hikes.Details: water and comfortable hiking shoes
water and comfortable shoes
water, comfortable shoes, and a camera or binoculars
water, hiking shoes, camera or binoculars

The Huckleberry Trail covers 1-1/3 miles and the walk will be about 80 minutes. The beauty of the park, and the Pioneer Farm fence covered in the wintry glow, celebrates a New Year. Dress appropriately – warm clothes, proper shoes or boots, and water.

Bust n' Boom along the Elakala Trail starting at 10:00 a.m.   This is a walk along the canyon's rim, past some huge sandstone formations and over a section of Shy Run with interpretive stops along the way.  History, flora and fauna have winter appeal.  This hike will be about 70 minutes long and cover a mile with some steps involved.  Conditions can be icy.  Wear appropriate clothing and sturdy boots or shoes.  Bottle water is suggested as a carry along.  The hike is open to the public without cost.  Take your first hike into the New Year at Blackwater Falls State Park.

First day hikes are led hikes designed to encourage visitors to enjoy state parks year round and to promote good health and exercise. 
Beginning at 2:00 p.m. from the swimming pool parking lot, join Assistant Superintendent Kevin Dials and volunteers to venture on an afternoon hike to begin a new year. Bundle up; dress in layers. Come hike.

Meet Kim Hawkins at Pipestem McKeeever Lodge lobby at 1:00 p.m. for an afternoon hike to Long Branch Lake. Dress appropriately. Plan on about a 1-1/2 to 2 hour afternoon outdoors. Layer for the weather. Come hike.

A perfect opportunity to start 2015 by connecting nature, engaging in physical activity, and promote healthy lifestyles all year long. Meet the Naturalist at 10:00AM at the Park's Nature Center to explore the natural beauty of the Ridge Trail. This trail is approximately 1 ½ miles with a few hills.

First_Day_Hikes.Cancellation_Information: If there is snow on the ground, then the hike will be moved to improved roads within the state park.  For cancellation information, participates can call (785) 207-2692.
First_Day_Hikes.Restrictions: This is a mountain bike use so the trail is dirt with tree roots and rocks on the trail.  There are ravines.  The entire trail is not wheelchair accessible.  Leave no trace. What you pack in you pack out.
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Dress in layers and dress warmly; warm gloves and head covering; good walking/hiking shoes; walking/hiking poles, if desired; water; snacks, if needed.
First_Day_Hikes.Meeting_Location: Perry State Park Biking/Hiking Trails on Kimberly Dr. off West Lake Road.

First_Day_Hikes.Details:
Welcome in the New Year with an exhilarating 4 mile hike around the Bear Hair Trail.  The hike will be lead by volunteers from the Georgia Appalachian Trail Club (GATC).  They will share their vast knowledge of hiking and trail stories while surrounded by the beautiful views offered by the Bear Hair Trail.  Please, meet at the Vogel Visitor Center at 9 AM.  This hike will take you to the Bear Hair Overlook with vast
views of the valley below.
Bring water, snacks and sturdy shoes

First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: No minimum age but the trail is not accessible for strollers
First_Day_Hikes.Details: The "Luck and Wealth Hike" on the Muscidine Trail:  Welcome the New Year with a 1.2 - mile moderate hike on the Muscidine Trail. Finish the trail at our Beach Pavilion where hikers can add a little luck and wealth to their year by enjoying a sampling of black eyed peas and collard greens.  Register in advance at 706-356-4362 by December 30.  Come join us for the "Luck and Wealth" walk at Tugaloo State Park.  Bring water and wear sturdy shoes

Start off the year with an awe inspiring hike that will keep you in awe and inspire you for the entire year.This hike will take you off the beaten path and to an area not normally open to the public and will last about 3 hours.   This hike takes you to an area not generally seen by the public.  Wear sturdy shoes and bring water and snacks.

Meet at the park office for a hike on our 3/4 mile Trembling Earth Nature Trail. This hike will take you on our boardwalk through a mixed cypress and blackgum forest. On the way we will be on the lookout for the wildlife that inhabit the area, as well as some of the unique plant life. Come start the new year off right at Stephen Foster State Park.  Wear sturdy shoes.
Enjoy an afternoon hike through the marsh.  This guided hike will discuss history of Skidaway Island, marsh plants and local animals.

First_Day_Hikes.Park: Rocky Mountain Recreation & Public Fishing Area
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Start the first day of the year with a hike around the nature trail.  During this Ranger led hike, you'll learn about the flora, fauna, history and uniqueness of Rocky Mountain.

First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: No minimum age but the trail is not accessible for strollers
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Take a leisurely hike around the upland loop and enjoy s'mores around the campfire afterwards.  Bring water and wear sturdy shoes.

Start the year right with a beautiful nature hike with fitness activities along the way led by a volunteer at 2:00 p.m. This easy hike is about 3 miles long. Meet at the park office, wear comfortable shoes, and bring water and a snack.

Come enjoy a Camp Lawton history tour at 11:00 A.M led by a Park  Ranger while enjoying a short three-quarter mile hike. Meet at the park office, wear comfortable shoes, and bring water and a snack.  Bring water and wear sturdy shoes

Come join us for a ranger-led nature hike along our beautiful Big Creek Nature Trail.  We will see and discuss flora and fauna that are native to our area while getting fit for the New Year.  The trail is approximately 1.3 miles and an easy hike for almost all ages so bring the family.  Please dress appropriately, bring water and meet at the park office by 9:00 am.  Bring water, bug spray, sunscreen.

Come join us for a ranger led hike through the woods at dusk followed by a hike up the Temple Mound. We will dicuss the history of Kolomoki Mounds State Park along with the flora and fauna along the trail. This is a night hike so please dress appropriately with closed toe shoes and bring a flashlight. Meet at Group Shelter #2 at 6:00 pm.  We will be roasting marshmallows at the top of the Temple Mound after the hike.  Bring water and a flashlight.

First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: No minimum, but the hike involves stairs and hills
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Join a park ranger for a journey through time. Discover the history of Indian Springs State Park, sample the famous spring water, and tour the park museum. This moderate hike will involve some steps and hills. Participants meet at the park museum at 10am.  Hot chocolate served at the museum, experience park history while welcoming the New Year.  No pets inside museum.

First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: Family Adventure programs are usually ideal for children ages 5 and up. Children must be accompanied by an adult.
First_Day_Hikes.Details:
Join us for a 2-3 hour program. There will be a short overview and then we will walk to discover the seals that visit our area each winter.

Reservations are required and will be accepted starting two weeks prior to the program; please call (631) 668-5000. 

Program fees are as follows: $4 per adult, $3 for children ages 3-17, children under 3 are free. Vehicle use fees are due upon arrival during the fee collection season (dates vary at different parks).

First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: No Minmum age but trail is not stroller accessible.
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Start your new year's right with this moderate 1.5 mile walk along the famous waterfall and the Towaliga River. Uncover the history of High Falls as you walk thru the old power house. This moderate hike will involve some steps and steep hills.   Participants will have a chance to go inside the old powerhouse and see photos of when the powerhouse was in operation.   Bring water and wear closed toe shoes.

First_Day_Hikes.Cancellation_Information:
(516) 780-3295 or (516) 785-3614

If you are unable to keep your reservation, please call and cancel so that others may have the opportunity to attend.
First_Day_Hikes.Details:
A State Park naturalist will lead visitors on an hour and a half leisurely beach walk to an area where up to four species of seals can be observed. Along the way, there will be opportunities to see many winter birds and to explore marine geology. Please dress appropriately and wear comfortable footwear for hiking. Binoculars are recommended. 

Reservations are required and will be accepted beginning two weeks prior to each date. Space is limited. Fee: $4.00 per person, children under 3 are free (unless otherwise noted). Vehicle use fees must be paid upon arrival. 

To make reservations, or for more information, please call (516) 780-3295 or (516) 785-3614.
First_Day_Hikes.Meeting_Location: Theodore Roosevelt Nature Center at West End Field #1

First_Day_Hikes.Cancellation_Information: No Charge and no registration necessary 912-557-7744
First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: No minmum age but trail is not stroller accessible.
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Come enjoy a Ranger Guided Hike and learn about the Park Plant and Animal Life.  Bring water.

Burn off those Christmas calories as we take a birding hike through the sandhill management area on the 1.5 mile Gopher Trail Loop. We will also discuss the resource management efforts on-going to re-introduce longleaf pines to the area. Binoculars provided for first twelve registrants.  Hot chocolate and coffee will be served in the campground shelter after the hike. You will also have the opportunity for Q and A with the Park Manager.  Bring water, snacks, wear closed toe shoes.
Bring in the new year with a brisk walk and afternoon viewing of beautiful Marbury Creek water shed.  ADA Accessible!    Bring water.

First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: No minmum age but trail is not stroller accessible.
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Hikes will be offered at 2:00 and again at 3:30 p.m.   Start the year off right with a First Day Hike to the Stone Wall, Fire Watch Tower and West Overlook to take in some breathtaking views.  We will start in top parking lot and go to the rock wall first moving on to the stone fire tower and ending at the overlook.  This is a moderate rocky 1 mile hike, closed toe shoes required.  Cost $5.00 per person.  Bring water and wear closed toe shoes.
First_Day_Hikes.Trail: Stone Wall, Fire Tower, Overlook Trail

First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: Family Adventure programs are usually ideal for children ages 5 and up. Children must be accompanied by an adult.
First_Day_Hikes.Details:
Join us as we kick off the New Year with a hike to explore the preserve. Discover the changes in the forest during the winter and search for signs of wildlife surviving the snow. 

Reservations are required and will be accepted starting two weeks prior to the program. Please call (631) 581-1072. 

Program fees are as follows: $4 per adult, $3 for children ages 3-17, children under 3 are free. Vehicle use fees are due upon arrival during the fee collection season (dates vary at different parks).

First_Day_Hikes.Cancellation_Information: Hike will take place no matter what the weather conditions are.
First_Day_Hikes.Minimum_age_for_Children: No. All are welcome. Difficulty level will be beginner to moderate.
First_Day_Hikes.Details:
Pets are welcome. Dress for the weather (layers preferred), and bring own water/drink. 

Registration is not required, but is preferred. Participants must pre-register to receive giveaways at event. To pre-register, call 607-648-5251 & ask for Nancy or Mike.

Start the New Year off with a hike around the top loop of the West Rim that includes some of the best overlook views in the park. This is a moderate hike, please wear appropriate clothing for trail and weather conditions. Meet at the Interpretive Center parking area. $5 per person.

Bring:  Water, sturdy shoes, dress warmly.

Onsite registration from 12:00pm to 12:45pm.  
Event begins at 12:45pm.

WOOF WOOF!!  For the first time ever we will be hosting a dog friendly hike.   Bring the four legged friend along for a casual hike guided by park staff up the Mt. Prospect auto road which is about a 3.2 mile round trip and should take about 3 hours.  Dogs must be leashed at all time and owners are responsible for carrying out all pest waste.  At the summit guests will be greeted around a fire and have the chance to roast marshmallows while listening to Rachel Bruce (park manager) and Weeks State Park Association members interpret the historical significance of the property. Tubbs Snowshoes will offer limited supply of demo snowshoes for the hike.  After the hike gather around the base of the auto road for a warm drink and healthy snack as we warm up alongside a fire.

For more information visit www.nhstateparks.org or contact Eric Feldbaum at NHFDH@dred.nh.gov

Onsite registration from 11:00am to 11:45am.  
Hike begins at 11:45am.

Join Society for the Protection of New Hampshire Forests land stewards for a guided 3 mile hike along the Parker Trail to the Little Mountain Viewpoint- (approximately 3 hours).  For those looking for a more leisurely hike of 2 miles, join park staff  for a nature walk along the Parker Trail to the Cliff Walk Trail junction and back, which will take approximately 2 hours on relatively flat terrain. Park staff will share tips on spotting animal tracks, plant/tree identification, and some of the mountain’s history.  After the hike, take part in a warm drink and snack while warming up next to the fire in the Hiker’s Cabin. Stop by the Eastern Mountain Sports tent to check out the latest and greatest gear for this winter season. Tubbs Snowshoes will offer a limited supply of demo snowshoes for the hike.

For more information about  please visit www.nhstateparks.org or email Eric Feldbam at NHFDH@dred.nh.gov

Onsite registration from 12:00pm to 12:45pm. 
Hike begins at 12:45pm.


Join Society for the Protection of New Hampshire Forests land stewards for a guided natural history tour of the Little Harbor Loop Trail.  The Loop Trail is considered an easy hike, 1.5 miles in length, and approximately 1-1.5 hours to hike.  Land Stewards will be present to share the natural history of the abutting Creek Farm.  Join us to seek signs of wildlife, watch shorebirds on the tidal flats, discover a tidal pool and enjoy the many varieties of tree and plants that highlight Creek Farm as a unique costal habitat.  After the hike enjoy a warm drink and snack inside the beautiful Drift Art Gallery.  

For more infomation please visit our website www.nhstateparks.org or  contact Eric Feldbaum at NHFDH@dred.nh.gov

First_Day_Hikes.Cancellation_Information: Weather contingent, no reschedule if cancelled
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Dress warm and bring a camera for wildlife pictures.  The paved trail runs along Elk City Reservoir's shoreline.

Please bring weather appropriate clothing and water.

Additional information for participants (description of hike, what visitors might see, etc.): .  Join our naturalist and photographer Lynn McDowell as they hike though our park’s winter landscape.  Pre-registration at 302-577-7020 by Friday, December 26, 2014 is required.

Please bring water and weather appropriate attire.

Join us at the Nature Center on the first day of the New Year for a hike with new friends.  You will have a choice between a one-mile or one that is just over 2 ½ miles.

Please bring water and weather appropriate attire.

Join us at the Nature Center on the first day of the New Year for a hike with new friends.  You will have a choice between a one-mile or one that is just over 2 ½ miles.

First_Day_Hikes.Restrictions: Pets must be on a leash
First_Day_Hikes.Details:
Dress for the weather

Start the New Year off right with a 3.5 mile hike through the lesser-known “Fresh Pond Tract”, part of Delaware Seashore State Park.  Hikers will walk through a variety of habitats, including maritime forest, meadow, and salt marsh.

Please bring water, boots, snowshoes, hats, gloves, warm clothing, snacks, and a camera.

We will walk through the first preserve in DE, Tulip Tree Nature Preserve, where we will encounter a mix of large tulip trees, a variety of shrubs, and some of DuPont’s original stonewall.  We may get to hear Pileated Woodpeckers, Cardinals, and Blue Jays singing along our journey.  Dress appropriately as we learn about native plants, historical facts, and peer out to the creek

First_Day_Hikes.Restrictions: Pets must be on a leash
First_Day_Hikes.Details:
Please bring water, snacks, appropriate footwear.

Will walk mostly paved trails, we will walk by a meadow, woodland, and historic buildings.

Water, comfortable shoes
water, camera, comfortable shoes, and dress for the weather

First_Day_Hikes.Restrictions: Dogs must be on leash, no loger than 6 feet
First_Day_Hikes.Details: Dress appropriately for the weather. Bring any supplies you may need, such as a bottle of water and snacks.
First_Day_Hikes.Meeting_Location: Parking lot on Rocky Point Avenue near the former entrance

First_Day_Hikes.Details: Dress warm and in layers. Bring water
First_Day_Hikes.Meeting_Location: Meet in the main parking lot in front of the petroglyphs

First_Day_Hikes.Details: Please bring warm clothes and dress in layers.
Please bring warm clothes and dress in layers.  Dogs welcome
